poster: x R e n g a R x
title: @Riot...If you've reformed after a 2 week ban...
body:
So basically I got banned for 2 weeks because I had a rough couple days and I played this game during those days, and well, yeah.

I've came back reformed and I made a promise to myself to not even use chat anymore. Just play, use pings, call objectives...and move on.

My question is that let's say I'm on good behavior for a month and I have ONE bad day and tell someone 'gg get rekt' for example...

Do I get a perma ban? Does the punishment restart after a long period of time with no reports and go back to 10 game restriction?

The punishment tiers are:

* 10-game chat restriction
* 25-game chat restriction
* 14 day ban
*  Permanent ban

It takes 3 months to go down one tier, but you can also skip certain punishments depending on how toxic you are. If you're using hate speech and telling people to kill themselves, you'll either get a 2 week ban or a perma ban depending on how bad it is.

I dont think that's true. If you dont get reported for verbal/grief/hate speech you pretty much wont get flagged that fast.

If I don't chat at all and only call objectives, which I have been doing...there's no reason for them to ban me. 

I'm in Gold right now and will be hoping to get back in plat then I'm done for the season, will just play 1-2 games a month after that.

if there was a short period between your 10 game chat restrict / 25 game chat restrict / 14-day ban, then all it takes is 1 bad game to get yourself permaed. 

Got some more leeway if there was a long gap between your punishments, as it shows Riot that you are super toxic.

Basically that last chance is just that. You are in thin ice and basically any small reportable offense can trigger your permaban. But it does seem like you want to reform and as long as you keep that attitude up you'll do well. As you say just use pings, and play the game. None of that is reportable and try to minor chat or keep it off screen if you can. All else fail just mute everyone once the match starts and you'll do well!
